259002. Pomerania becomes Poland

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Krakow
  • Control Krakow
  • Own Kalisz
  • Own Poznan
  • The following must not occur:
    • Poland exists

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1419
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

We have united main polish lands under our rule. Shall we revive that old Kingdom of Poland?

Actions

A. We shall become Poland

  • Flag graphics set to default
  • Move capital to Krakow
  • Podlasie will be considered a claim province
  • Rus Halicka will be considered a claim province
  • Belz will be considered a claim province
  • Podkarpacie will be considered a claim province
  • Lublin will be considered a claim province
  • Warszawa will be considered a claim province
  • Plock will be considered a claim province
  • Sandomierz will be considered a claim province
  • Krakow will be considered a national province
  • Bydgoszcz will be considered a claim province
  • Poznan will be considered a claim province
  • Kalisz will be considered a claim province
  • Dobrzyn will be considered a claim province
  • Torun will be considered a claim province
  • Pomerelia will be considered a claim province
  • Warmia will be considered a claim province
  • german will no longer be an accepted culture
  • german will become an accepted culture
  • +50 victory points
  • Event 20129 - Recovery of Pomerania for Poland will never fire

B. No, we have other things to do

  • Stability +1

Back to top

259007. Bogislaw dies before Erik

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Denmark exists
  • Pomerania owns Gotland

Will happen within 90 days of January 2, 1449
Checked again every 90 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1459)
unless prevented by
Action A of 159046 - The future heir for Denmark

Description

Even though Erik managed to have Bogislaw made his rightful heir Bogislaw died before Erik. After the death of the Danish king, Christopher of Bavaria, the following monarch was Erik's kinsman, Christian I of Denmark, who was the son of Erik's earlier rival, Count Theodoric of Oldenburg. To him Erik handed over Gotland in return for the permission to leave for Pomerania.

Actions

A. Leave Pomerania to Erik (End Game)

  • Cede Gotland to Denmark

Back to top

259008. The invasion of Gotland

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Gotland
  • Event 291021 - Sweden claims Gotland and Norway for Sweden has already occurred

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1449
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1459)

Description

In 1449 the Swedish forces in Gotland aided Erik in the war against the Danes. While Erik was successful in defending the island, he realised that there was no way he could win the war. Therefore he agreed to leave Gotland to the Danes for safe passage to Pomerania.

Actions

A. Return control of Gotland to Denmark

  • Cede Gotland to Denmark
  • Gotland will no longer be considered a national province
  • Event 291024 - The invasion of Gotland for Sweden is triggered immediately
  • Event 159049 - The invasion of Gotland for Denmark is triggered immediately
  • Event 291025 - Gotland is yet again in Danish hands for Sweden will never fire

Back to top

259017. Loss of Danzig

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Pomerelia
  • Control Pomerelia
  • Poland is a neighbor

Will happen within 200 days of June 2, 1465
Checked again every 200 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1478)

Description

The populace of Danzig being dissatisfied with the aristocracy of the Pomeranian nobles forced the Pomeranian government to transfer the Kumberland, Ermland and Danzig to the Polish Crown.

Actions

A. Cede it

  • Cede Pomerelia to Poland
  • -30 relations with Poland
  • Stability +1

B. Let us keep it

  • -100 relations with Poland
  • -2 badboy

Back to top

259018. Capital relocation

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Stettin
  • Control Stettin
  • None of the following must occur:
    • Stettin exists
    • Flag [Stettin] is set

Will happen within 100 days of March 2, 1487
Checked again every 100 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1498)

Description

Stolp was founded by Germans in the 6th century. In the 9th century the town was fortified and a small Slavic village was built on a hill. In the Middle Ages the area began to be settled in great number by ethnic Germans who built up the town. Any local Slavic culture which had existed disappeared as local people were assimilated and became germanised. In the reign of Bogislaw X a decision was made to move the capital to the more prospers city of Bialogard or to the newly acquired city of Stettin. Stettin was chosen.

Actions

A. Move the capital

  • Move capital to Stettin
  • Wolgast will be considered a claim province
  • Stettin will be considered a claim province
  • Stability +1
  • Flag graphics extension set to "Stettin"
  • Set flag [Stettin] for events

B. Let keep it where it is

  • Stability +1
  • -1 badboy

Back to top

259023. Marriage with Anna of Poland

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Poland exists

Will happen within 100 days of February 2, 1491
Checked again every 100 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1496)

Description

Bogislaw X contemplated binding Pomerania to Poland in a personal union. In 1491 he married Anna Jagiellonka, daughter of Casimir IV. Chancellor Jan Laski subsequently offered to pay tribute to the Polish king, but he declined.

Actions

A. Limit yourself to marriage

  • Gain a royal marriage with Poland
  • +50 relations with Poland

B. May Poland protect us

  • Break vassalization with -1
  • +50 relations with Poland
  • -50 relations with Brandenburg
  • Culture in Pommern changes to polish
  • Change the city name in Pommern to Slupsk
  • Event 258099 - Pomerania agrees to be our vassal for Poland is triggered immediately

Back to top

259019. Pyritz Agreement

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Brandenburg exists
  • None of the following must occur:
    • Pomerania is a vassal of Brandenburg
    • Pomerania and Brandenburg are at war

Will happen within 100 days of May 18, 1493
Checked again every 100 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1498)

Description

At the Pyritz Agreement, Duke Bogislaw X, succeeded with lifting the lien and swearing an allegiance to supply Brandenburg with Pomeranian troops, but Bogislaw X did not agree on the inheritance sequence.

Actions

A. Agree to it

  • +30 relations with Brandenburg
  • -25 relations with Poland
  • -25 relations with Denmark
  • Gain an alliance with Brandenburg
  • Stability +1

B. No Pomeranian troops for Brandenburg

  • -50 relations with Brandenburg
  • +25 relations with Poland
  • +25 relations with Denmark
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill -2 for 24 months

Back to top

259004. The League of Schmalkalden

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Austria exists
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is protestant
    • State religion is reformed

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1527
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1529)

Description

After Emperor Charles V had rejected the Protestants' confessional positions at the Imperial Parliament of Augsburg (1529-1530), the North German Protestant Imperial estates formed the League of Schmalkalden, with a joint army and treasury and seeking ties abroad (France). The League enjoyed early successes in the years 1532-1540 as the Emperor was threaten by Turkish danger and forced to conclude Religious peace settlements in Nuremberg (1532) and Kaaden (1534).

Actions

A. Give it our support

  • +100 relations with France
  • +100 relations with England
  • +150 relations with Brandenburg
  • +150 relations with Hanover
  • +150 relations with Hesse
  • +150 relations with Palatinate
  • +150 relations with Saxony
  • +150 relations with Ansbach
  • +100 relations with Cleves
  • +50 relations with Cologne
  • +50 relations with Bavaria
  • -100 relations with Papal States
  • -100 relations with Spain
  • -150 relations with Austria
  • +50 relations with Strassburg

B. Ignore it

  • -100 relations with Brandenburg
  • -100 relations with Hanover
  • -100 relations with Hesse
  • -100 relations with Palatinate
  • -100 relations with Saxony
  • -100 relations with Ansbach
  • +50 relations with Austria
  • -100 relations with Strassburg

Back to top

259020. Grimnitz Agreement

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Pomerania is a vassal of Brandenburg

Will happen within 100 days of August 28, 1529
Checked again every 100 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1538)

Description

At the Grimnitz Agreement, the Brandenburg Electors agreed to release the lien over Pomerania, but accepted the inheritance of Pomerania in the case of no male heir.

Actions

A. Agree to it

  • +30 relations with Brandenburg
  • Break vassalization with Brandenburg
  • Stability +1

Back to top

259021. Loitz house

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Stettin
  • Control Stettin
  • None of the following must occur:
    • Country has at least 3 non-colonial provinces
    • All of the following must occur:
      • Own Pomerelia
      • Berg is a center of trade

Will happen within 100 days of November 22, 1572
Checked again every 100 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1578)

Description

The Great Stettin trading house of the Loitz's family finally went bankrupt after 200 years.

Actions

A. Damn, trade loss

  • -2 base tax value in Stettin
  • Stability -3

Back to top

3895. The Pomeranian Inheritance

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Country is controlled by AI
  • Sweden exists
  • Brandenburg exists
  • Own Stettin

Will happen on March 11, 1637

Description

The ruling family of Pommern has died out! Legally, Brandenburg is the heir, but the powerful Swedes demand a portion of the inheritance. What shall be our decision?

Actions

A. Split Pommern between Sweden and Brandenburg (End Game)

  • Cede Wolgast to Sweden
  • Cede Stettin to Sweden
  • Event 3896 - The Pommern Inheritance for Brandenburg is triggered immediately
  • Event 291029 - The Acquisition of Vorpommern for Sweden is triggered immediately

B. Let Brandenburg receive all of Pommern (End Game)

  • Event 3896 - The Pommern Inheritance for Brandenburg is triggered immediately

Back to top

259009. The Pomeranian Inheritance

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Country is controlled by AI
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • The following must not occur:
      • Sweden exists
    • The following must not occur:
      • Own Stettin
  • Brandenburg exists

Will happen on March 11, 1637

Description

The ruling family of Pommern has died out! Legally, Brandenburg is the heir...

Actions

A. Let Brandenburg receive all of Pommern (End Game)

  • Event 3896 - The Pommern Inheritance for Brandenburg is triggered immediately

259010. The Pomeranian Inheritance

Pomerania — Not random

Conditions

  • Sweden exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Brandenburg exists
  • Own Stettin
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 132202 - The Cleves succession for Brandenburg has already occurred
    • Event 132203 - Inheritance of Cleves for Brandenburg has already occurred
    • Event 132204 - Treaty of Xanten for Brandenburg has already occurred
    • Event 132205 - War over the Cleves succession for Brandenburg has already occurred

Will happen on March 12, 1637

Description

The ruling family of Pommern has died out! Legally, the House of Hohenzollern is the rightful heir, but since they have been dispossessed of their dominions in the Mark of Brandenburg by foreign invaders they cannot rightfully claim the imperial investiture of the duchy. Also because of that the powerful Swedes demand the acquisition of Pomerania. What shall be our decision?

Actions

A. Ask the Emperor for the investiture of Brandenburg

  • Event 132008 - The Pomeranian Inheritance for Brandenburg will never fire
  • Berlin will be considered a claim province
  • Brandenburg will be considered a claim province
  • Magdeburg will be considered a claim province
  • Neumark will be considered a claim province
  • Lebus will be considered a claim province
  • Kulmbach will be considered a claim province
  • Ansbach will be considered a claim province
  • Pomerelia will be considered a claim province
  • Kleef will be considered a claim province
  • Jülich will be considered a claim province
  • Mark will be considered a claim province
  • -50 relations with Sweden
  • +50 relations with Austria
  • polish will no longer be an accepted culture
  • Event 259016 - The investiture of Brandenburg for Pomerania is triggered immediately

B. Stay as Pomerania and cede Stettin to Sweden

  • Centralization +1
  • Event 132009 - New Capital for Brandenburg will never fire
  • Event 291029 - The Acquisition of Vorpommern for Sweden is triggered immediately

C. Let Sweden receive the entire Pomerania (End Game)

  • Event 132009 - New Capital for Brandenburg will never fire
  • Event 291030 - The Acquisition of Pomerania for Sweden is triggered immediately

D. Stay as duchy of Pomerania

  • Event 132009 - New Capital for Brandenburg will never fire
  • -50 relations with Sweden

Back to top

259003. Bogislaw IX is the heir to the Danish throne

Pomerania — Not random

Triggered by

Action B of 159046 - The future heir for Denmark

Description

In 1437 King Erik of Denmark managed to get the Danish State Council to accept that Bogislaw IX should be the rightful heir to the Danish throne.

Actions

A. Great!

  • Stability +1

Back to top

259000. Inheritance of Pomerania-Stettin

Pomerania — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 283000 - The succession in Pomerania-Stettin for Stettin

Description

Otto III of Pomerania-Stettin died of the plague in 1464, without an heir. Both his relatives in Pomerania-Wolgast - the Dukes Erich II and Wartislaw IX - and his feudal overlord, the Elector of Brandenburg, claimed the inheritance. After several years of struggling, Erich of Pomerania-Wolgast secured the inheritance against Brandenburg's claims, however had to accept its feudal suzerainty. After multiple divisions, most of Pomerania was then united again under Erich, and his son Bogislaw obtained the rest, becoming Duke of all of Pomerania.

Actions

A. Accept the inheritance and Brandenburg's suzerainty

  • Wolgast will be considered a claim province
  • Stettin will be considered a claim province
  • Inherit the realms of Stettin
  • -50 relations with Brandenburg
  • Stability +3
  • Event 132019 - Suzerainty over Pomerania for Brandenburg is triggered immediately

B. Let Brandenburg have Stettin

  • -20 victory points
  • Event 132018 - Inheritance of Stettin for Brandenburg is triggered immediately

Back to top

259001. Inheritance of Pomerania-Stettin

Pomerania — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 283002 - The succession in Pomerania-Stettin for Stettin

Description

Otto III of Pomerania-Stettin died of the plague in 1464, without an heir. His relatives in Pomerania-Wolgast - the Dukes Erich II and Wartislaw IX - managed to secure the inheritance. After multiple divisions, most of Pomerania was then united again under Erich, and his son Bogislaw obtained the rest, becoming Duke of all of Pomerania.

Actions

A. Great!

  • Wolgast will be considered a claim province
  • Stettin will be considered a claim province
  • Inherit the realms of Stettin

Back to top

Description

Actions

  • Wolgast will be considered a claim province
  • Stettin will be considered a claim province

Pomerania — Not random

Triggered by
